characters: EXT BURIAL SITE ABOVE BOOTH'S TRAILER
INT PATROL CAR ON DIRT ROAD
JUST THE ORIGINAL, AND I'LL TAKE

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TRAILER HOME
dialogues.text: It's isolated in a cul-de-sac of hills, with a dirt road

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: The place is decked out in classic bachelor.  Clothes eve Your mother would hate this place, but it's fine with -- SALLY HOGAN, an attractive WOMAN in her early 30's, who r She is nude, and has a look of blissful exhaustion on her She says nothing for a beat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it? Sally looks at the clock on the nightstand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat, closes her eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four-thirty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get ready. We then see a MAN sit up and swing his legs over the bed. Sally hugs him from behind -- he reaches his arm around h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still have time. Booth gets up, grabbing a random pair of underwear and wh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go to the bank before it closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta take some money out,  that's what for. Booth begins to put on his DEPUTY uniform --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an ATM on Speedwell Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but I need to take out four hundred dollars and the ATM will  only give me three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred. Thinking of buying  me something nice? Booth puts on his BELT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not that I wouldn't sugar  bun but Earl's in a bind.  They're  going to take his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's irresponsible. Booth puts on his olive green TIE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah hell, he'd do the same for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he would, probably. Booth sits on the edge of the bed and ties his black leat Booth gets up and brushes his hair --  Sally wraps the sheet around her and stands behind him -- Sally turns him around and straightens his tie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you get it back... (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could have a lot of fun  with four hundred dollars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a room in a nice hotel for a  few hours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might have to look into that... They continue to kiss --

dialogues.speaker: EXT SHERIFF'S STATION
dialogues.text: The building is a small sub-station off a two-lane highwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you, some people are too damn  smart for their own good. Take that case in Richfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother son thing...

dialogues.speaker: INT SHERIFF'S STATION
dialogues.text: We see Sheriff DWAYNE HOGAN, a stout, ruddy-faced man in JESSE SEGUNDO, a Hispanic man in his late 30's, with a mi Also in the room are Booth and his partner EARL WHITNEY, to the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon as they got her on the table they knew it was murder, stroke or no.  I mean, what was this dumb son of a bitch thinking?  Trained  professionals wouldnГ­t find a needle  mark in her arm? Dwayne leans back and stretches, somewhat indifferent to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just goes to show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean at least pick a more discreet place, the scalp, under the armpit, under the tongue, someplace where the  trained eye wonГ­t immediately look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse wipes his forehead with his HANDKERCHIEF -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn itГ­s hot in here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He probably figured she was on her way out anyhow, no drugs in her system, no foul play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne, IГ­m telling you a coroner has the skills and abilities to determine those things.  If you pump air into someoneГ­s vein, a series of traumas occur that are clearly visible upon dissection. Dwayne looks at Booth and Earl, who crack faint  smiles -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very clumsy, very clumsy.  IГ­d have found it in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right youГ­re the super sleuth, what do you want, a medal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what I would like is the forty  dollars you owe me, and IГ­m a busy man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit youГ­re persistent.  I donГ­t want to listen to this anymore.  No more bets with you. Dwayne takes out his CHECKBOOK - Jesse seems put off by  this -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, now thatГ­s gonna take time to  clear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (writing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it or leave it. Booth and Earl seem amused by this encounter -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what was your point, Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My point?  My point is that by  analyzing all the various ways by  which we kill each other, it seems  to me there is no perfect crime.   WeГ­ll get ya somehow, some way.   Except maybe if you use  potassium of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Jesse looks at the two me with a comically steely  expression -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy to purchase, hard to detect. Too much potassium can kill a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must get a lot of babes with  lines like that. Everyone laughs but Jesse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you need to get away from all those stiffs.  Find yourself a  little senorita of your own. An awkward beat, as Jesse stares at the floor.  Dwayne pi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you even have a girlfriend,  Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of. Dwayne gets up, grabbing his lunch box --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Dwayne why don't you introduce him to your funeral parlor cousin? Dwayne sucks on his teeth for a beat.  From his expressio Jesse's blood in the family line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not his type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  That's all I need, to become  one of your in-laws. Dwayne then grabs his coat off the rack, and begins to he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IГ­m out of here. Jesse stands up -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, deputies, take care,  don't let your meat loaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry the real men are in  charge now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of which that reminds me I have to bring something home or eat Sally's meatloaf again, and  I don't think I could stand that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're always griping.  Cut her  some slack! Dwayne heads out -- Booth watches him leave --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never had it.   (emphatically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's exactly like dog food. Earl laughs.  Booth gives a courtesy smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to roll, partner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing, and --  Booth slaps an envelope into Earl's hand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't spend it all in one place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd come through. Jesse observes the transaction Booth and Earl start to le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that all about? Booth turns to Jesse as he heads out behind Earl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drug deal.  Pay it no mind. Jesse watches them leave --

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: A lone PATROL CAR drives down the highway --

dialogues.speaker: INT PATROL CAR
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the RADIO on the dash, which crackles to life --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen, you out there, copy? Booth, who is driving, Picks up the radio --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fourteen, what's up Trudy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a call from Hank Scammel.  He's         worried about Otis.  Can't seem to  find him anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He probably died of old age. The two men laugh -- Booth keys the walkie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right Trudy we'll take a pass down Route 9, see if we can find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Booth. Booth hangs up the radio --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old is Otis anyhow, thirty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horniest dog in Nevada. Earl looks out the window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the loan, man.  I'll have it in a few days, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I hope so.  That pretty much cleaned me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have asked my sister, but its better to leave family out,  always leads to trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The patrol car turns on to the desolate road and drives  off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...I remember my brother-in-law  Gary, the wheel watcher.  He finally got on the show and won seven thousand  dollars!  Plus some leather furniture.   Do you think I saw any of that?  His  excuse was the government got it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven thousand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would have won more but he blew it at the end.  Didn't know what  Cash and Carry was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash and what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash and Carry, you know, FDR, World War two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you would have done great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I probably would have.  I guess  the clues damn near before everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what everyone thinks.  But according to him, when it's the real thing, it's quite an intimidatin' environment in which to concentrate. Suddenly Booth sees something up ahead, his expression ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? Soon he JAMS on his brakes --  POV         WILLIE lies in the road --

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Booth and Earl get out and run over to the body, which ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? Booth rolls the man over, checks for a pulse --  The gunman's lifeless eyes stare back at him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't from around here --  (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's deader than Caesar. Earl looks around with his flashlight -- then sees someth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ominously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the car...  Earl starts walking down the road --  Booth watches him, then stands up startled by what he  sees --

dialogues.speaker: EXT GAS STATION
dialogues.text: The patrol car headlines illuminate the scene of the  crime --  Bodies everywhere, blood, broken glass --  Earl shines his mag light around the scene as Booth gets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're out of towners... Arizona plates... Earl heads over to the back of the Mercedes.  The trunk i Booth goes down and checks the pulse of another dead  gunman --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, they're all dead... Earl opens the trunk carefully, and reacts with surprise  at WHAT HE SEES. Booth gets up, looks around, checks another one's pulse -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'll be damned, I've never  seen anything like this... Gangbangers.  Must have been a  drug deal or something, whaddya  think? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's call this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you better come over here partner... Booth turns around and looks at Earl, then approaches him We see Booth approach the trunk -- as he looks inside his POV inside the trunk there is a STEAMER TRUNK.  Inside th arranged HUNDRED-DOLLAR BILLS, a little under three hundr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy...shit... Stunned, the men look at each other. Booth takes a packet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten thousand right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (digging through bag)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be over a million dollars in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, more than that. Earl and Booth look at each other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy... The two stare at the money in startled silence for a beat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting some flares... Booth heads off, as Earl pulls out a CIGARETTE out of a p He thinks for a moment, then drops the cigarette and stom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! Earl follows Booth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean what are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean --  Earl grabs Booth's arm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do? The two men look at each other, both knowing what the oth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it in I guess. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  Are you kidding me? Booth looks at him, then grabs some flares out of the  trunk -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  We can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look around you partner!  You said yourself you never saw anything like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know whose money it is!  They might have robbed  a bank, who knows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbed a bank, c'mon!  Don't you think we would have heard if one, two --  (looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shit I don't know how many were  at large!  Don't you think there would be a bulletin?  This is a  big ass drug deal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Booth!  Look at these  scumbags around us.  Who's going  to know what happened!  Let's take  it and get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well someone's gonna find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, it won't be us! Booth looks at Earl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Trudy we were coming down  this way, that's why!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll figure something out. Booth says nothing, as if he is actually considering it -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's the next time you'll be face to face with a couple million dollars in cash, Booth?   Never! Booth looks at him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We would never have to worry about  money -- ever again, Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose someone knows about the  money?  They're bound to ask  questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's going to question us?   Dwayne?  Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to go bigger than that.   Could you stare someone straight  in the face and lie about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll worry about that when it  happens and if it happens, and it's  not gonna happen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because...I know. Earl looks at Booth, and pleads his case --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no accident we stumbled on this money.  It's an answer to a prayer!   (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every night and every day I've  prayed that God would just --  help me out a little, give me a  little push.  Tonight my prayer  came true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh so God's like Western Union and  he just dropped us a couple million  bucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the expense of six people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (righteously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They killed themselves.  Besides, they were breaking the law.  What they were doing was wrong! (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatsamatter Booth, don't you believe in miracles? Booth looks at him, then at the Mercedes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, what do you say?  If we're going to do this we have to do it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right hold on!  Lemme think... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, did you touch the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.  It's little shit like that sends people to jail! We  have to cover all the bases  if we're going to pull this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right we will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl thinks about it -- crickets chirp in the background Earl goes to the trunk of the patrol car and pulls out a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll cover all our damn bases... Booth looks at Earl, then back at the Mercedes, riddled w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll torch the bases, how's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torch it?! Earl approaches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll leave a few packets in the  trunk, and stash the rest somewhere  else.  Car went up in the gunfight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booth looks at Earl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Booth.  Let's do this while we can.

dialogues.speaker: EXT GAS STATION
dialogues.text: Earl throws the last packets into a plastic bag held open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two million eight hundred thousand --  sweet mother we're millionaires. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll leave a couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got one condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to be patient. If we  start flashing money around, buying  fancy cars and fancy clothes, people  are going to ask questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we won't do any of that shit! Earl leaves a couple of packets in the trunk, taking one of the remaining packets --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least not for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl then takes a CAN of gasoline and begins to pour it o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick the money in our trunk --  Booth wraps the bag tightly around the money and places i he watches as Earl pours the gas under the car, then begi He then steps back -- the two men look at each other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a match? Booth looks at Earl then gives him his matches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here goes...get back... Earl lights the C-note - CLOSE shot of the bill slowly approaching the fuel --  WHOOMP! The fuel IGNITES as Earl and Booth run back to th is ENGULFED IN FLAMES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That tank's gonna blow --  BOOM!!!! The gas tank of the car EXPLODES, sending debris Booth and Earl cover themselves, illuminated by the brigh The two men watch --  The car is a flaming metal skeleton -- black smoke pours Earl then looks at Booth -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's call this sucker in.

dialogues.speaker: EXT GAS STATION
dialogues.text: Earl finishes on the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...just south of mile marker                  87 on Route 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that. Earl hangs up, walking over to Booth as he checks around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this was a drug deal, where are the drugs? Earl lights up a MENTHOL CIGARETTE and contemplates the n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First thing I'm going to do is check out that new casino,  whatever the hell itГ­s called. Get a nice suite for myself,  some high-priced hookers and  some slow-roasted prime rib!  Booth turns and looks at him, angrily --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about!   We have a deal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the time comes, that is. (Beat, overjoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallelujah Booth!  We are rich! (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: Earl slaps Booth on the back, Booth smiles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know.   (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm putting it out of my mind and you should too --  Suddenly the air is pierced by the SOUND OF PHLEGMY

dialogues.speaker: CHOKING
dialogues.text: Booth and Earl freeze --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that? The two men look around -- the sound is coming from behin Earl and Booth runs over and stop dead in their tracks -- DENNING has rolled over on to his back, struggling to bre stares back at the two men -- he tries to speak but it is gurgle -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear me?  Denning struggles to talk but can't, he nods --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Earl gets down closer to Denning --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he trying to say!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!  Son of a bitch!   Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He saw everything! Grabbing him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Denning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you been lying there  playing possum with us, huh?   Answer me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll tell them everything to save  his ass. That's how they all work  it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl turns and looks to Booth -- Booth stares back at him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...no!  No way! (clenches fist)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That money is in our hands! Earl grabs Denning who stares back at him, mute --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you hear!  How much did  you hear! Earl kicks the dirt in a rage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Booth looks at Denning.  Earl snarls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna have to get rid of him. Booth and Earl look at each other --  Then Booth looks around him anxiously, panic beginning to to understand what Earl means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not letting some gangbanger send me to jail.  We can't risk it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you thinking? Earl looks at Denning, who looks pleadingly back at him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're thinking about killing him. (backing up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that.  No way.  I've never killed a man.  Never even shot at one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well neither have I, but it's us or him.  If he talks, or writes a note, or whatever, he's gonna turn us in.  Besides,  he's a low life scumbag.   (turning to Denning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His kind is hardly even human  anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then.  I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. Do you want to go to jail?   Taking evidence, tampering with a  crime scene.  You know what they'd do.   Earl looks at Booth.  Stares hard.  Booth looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would have done it to us,  right? Booth looks at him -- Earl waits a moment, then rips off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. (grabbing Booth's  shoulders)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our little secret, partner. Booth nods.  Earl crumples the jacket into a ball and squ hard on Denning's face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's gonna miss your ass anyhow! Denning begins to struggle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit help me out here! Booth hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Booth! Finally, Booth restrains Denning while Earl presses down Booth turns his head away. Denning struggles violently --  The men struggle to suffocate Denning -- then Booth perks Soon the faint sound of SIRENS gets louder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming! HIGH SHOT - A small group of lights closes on the gas sta Earl hears the sirens and furiously crushes the coat down keeps fighting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit! The LIGHTS of the cars soon are visible to both of them - An AMBULANCE is followed by a PATROL CAR and a FIRE

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE
dialogues.text: In the nick of time Earl rips the coat away and lays it o Booth looks over his shoulder to see the oncoming vehicle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl pulls Denning onto the coat as the vehicles pull up The PARAMEDIC runs over to Earl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, we got a live one here, shot in the throat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear me! Earl stands up and looks down at Denning --  Denning stares back up at him, the hate in his eyes going

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the ambu bag?! Dwayne Hogan gets out of the patrol car with Jesse --  He approaches Booth as another PARAMEDIC assists the firs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like some kind of drug deal or something, they're not from around here --  (looking back at Denning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: one of them's still alive. Earl stands above the paramedics --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you move him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, well he sort of moved himself. I was trying to stabilize him, clear his throat --  Fireman douse the car as Dwayne, Jesse and Booth approach Booth and Earl play it cool as the paramedics work --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lost a lot of oil -- can you hear me buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he can tell us just what the hell happened here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me buddy -- focus! Denning's eyes continue to glaze over -- the paramedics g a resuscitating bag to give him oxygen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he going to make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm getting no radial pulse! The paramedics hoist Denning up and toward the ambulance Earl watches them, looks at Booth --  Booth stands with Dwayne and Jesse and looks back at Earl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to know what they were  doing in my town! (to Booth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get ID off any of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of them had any --  The paramedics open the ambulance door and load Denning i paramedic gets on the radio --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK notify the trauma center team  our ETA is twenty-five minutes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feeling Denning's  neck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.  I'm losing the carotid  pulse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by. The first paramedic assists the second --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lift the legs!  Come on buddy,  fight! Earl watches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...buddy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're losing him! CLOSE on Earl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...come on... The paramedics begin to administer chest compressions -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on buddy fight!  Fight! The paramedics continue in vain --  Earl watches, clutching his fists at his side --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not going to make it --  In another part of the crime scene, Dwayne aims his flash his eyes seem to display a keen ability to find inconsist Soon he nears the spot where Denning relieved himself - h He locates some FOOTPRINTS, those of Denning, leading awa Dwayne notices the footprints and aims his flashlight int he turns the light off and heads back to the others -  Dwayne approaches Booth, Jesse, and the paramedic ---  Earl and Booth look at each other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.  We lost him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a deep breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get some hounds down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause we got footprints leading  into that brush, I want to see where it leads... (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, seven dead.  I'll tell you  I've never seen carnage like this  in all my seventeen years of  sheriffing these parts. (Beat, spits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it.  Not in my  jurisdiction. Dwayne heads toward camera as Earl and booth watch him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gonna be in the papers, fellas. Booth and Earl look at each other grimly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll finish up here.

dialogues.speaker: EXT ROAD
dialogues.text: Booth and Earl's patrol car drives down the highway, away

dialogues.speaker: INT PATROL CAR
dialogues.text: Booth and Earl say nothing for a stretch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you it was a miracle the way things turned out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to hear about miracles and God and all that!  We tried to murder someone to cover our asses!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we didn't kill him, he died on his own. Booth flashes a totally unconvinced look at Earl and look

dialogues.speaker: EXT DIRT ROAD
dialogues.text: The patrol car pulls up past the camera. EXT. TRAILER HOME -- DAY. The patrol car comes to a stop in front of Booth's traile

dialogues.speaker: INT PATROL CAR ON DIRT ROAD
dialogues.text: Booth looks at Earl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  Dwayne was right.  This is going to be a big story.  So big in fact that I don't want to even have this money around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough, I'll take it to my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.  We're going to bury it, and we're not going to even think about it until everything dies down. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And no one, I mean no one hears a word about it.         Understand? Earl looks at Booth for a beat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: EXT BURIAL SITE ABOVE BOOTH'S TRAILER
dialogues.text: The men are on the hilltop above Booth's place.  The ligh full moon above, are the only sources of illumination. The men carry the bag of money to a hole they have finish They lower it into the hole and Booth prepares to tape up Earl stops him, takes a pinch of bills out of one of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little won't hurt us. Earl looks at Booth as he gives him $600 -- Booth accepts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're even.                         POV of Booth and Earl looking down at the money.  They be darkening the frame until it is black --

dialogues.speaker: INT HOGAN BEDROOM
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a ringing phone near a clock radio reading
Sally answers the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard you had quite a night.

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Booth is on the phone, looking out the window at the hill money lies buried. BOOTH'S POV of the hilltop burial site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was all over the local news.   Dwayne was there, acting all  official.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  You coming by tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just tired is all.  I'll see  you tonight OK baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.  I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too. Booth hangs up the phone and looks out the window again -

dialogues.speaker: INT SHERIFF'S STATION
dialogues.text: Booth walks into the station -- he looks ahead, surprised Earl is sitting with Dwayne and an attractive woman in he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booth I'm glad you're here we've been waiting for you. Booth approaches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Agent Ellen Martin. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's with the DEA. Booth looks at Earl for a split second then shakes Martin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we can get started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to ask you some questions about last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. (calmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've all got questions about what happened. Earl pulls out his menthol cigarettes, and lights one up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind not smoking? Earl looks at Dwayne, and Booth, then back at Martin -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. Earl drops the cigarette on the ground --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, do you remember seeing any  vehicles traveling near the site,  on your way to or from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because someone may have gotten  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had hounds down at the scene, the footprint trail was a bust. And there were no other tire tracks in the vicinity. Martin looks at the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that.  But from  what we know, there was a  large sum of money involved in  the transaction, about three  million dollars. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems to have disappeared. Booth whistles at the amount --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could it have been in the  Mercedes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  That's where it was  during Denning's last report. Earl shifts in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denning's their man on the  inside. Martin pulls a photo out of a file in front of her.  Hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the man you tried to save  last night. Agent Paul Denning.   We were working together. (sighs, long beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was deep undercover with these dealers for a while.  They ran a  big operation in Arizona, Nevada,  California.   Earl fights to play it cool as Dwayne listens to Martin, the worst shape of all, sickened by the revelation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally we would have tracked him with a wiretap, but it was standard for him to occasionally drop out when working with these guys. The last we heard from him was two days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean that guy was an agent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Wife and a kid.   (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't blame yourself, Deputy.  You  did all you could.  You have our deepest gratitude...and my personal thanks. A pregnant pause envelopes the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, I've asked Sheriff Hogan for permission to enter a letter of commendation in each  of your files. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Denning was a good man. I served with him for nearly five years... Booth looks at Earl, hard.  Earl decides to break the sil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess we won't find out  what happened. Martin gets up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we have one lead and that's  what I'm looking into next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denning was wearing a bug.  Booth and Earl look at each other -- Dwayne gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kept a recording of all such  transactions in order to keep  track of who's who, what was said,  what's happening.  I contacted your  local coroner, and he found it taped  to his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's news to me.  So it's over at Jesse's office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I told him I'd be there  before five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. I'll go down with you. Dwayne looks at Booth and Earl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys coming? Booth and Earl watch the two get ready to leave --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll follow in our car.

dialogues.speaker: EXT ROAD
dialogues.text: Dwayne's patrol car zooms down the road -- soon Booth and

dialogues.speaker: INT PATROL CAR
dialogues.text: Booth and Earl drive, completely panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're dead.  We're dead,  We are dead... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a joke. What are we going to do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know you want me to put  on my cape and fly there?! (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to play it cool... besides there might be nothing  on that tape anyway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy was a Federal agent. An officer of the law, just like  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we didn't know that at the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We assaulted a Federal agent.  We killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we didn't.  He died on his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right, with a little help from his pals Booth and Earl.  I'm sure that's gonna fly real far when they hear that tape... A horrible pause.  Then Booth finally says it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta turn ourselves in, before  they hear the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you nuts?  They'll fry us for  sure.  There's no way we're doin'  that, you understand?  No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the right thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the stupid thing to do,  that's what it is. Booth considers for a moment.  Relents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have known something like this was going to happen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man take it easy!  You're sweating like crazy!   Booth takes a deep breath, trying to calm himself down -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happens, don't lose your  cool.

dialogues.speaker: EXT STREET
dialogues.text: The car drives off --

dialogues.speaker: INT CORONER'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a pair of hands holding a PLASTIC EVIDENCE BAG - RECORDER and a small MICROPHONE attached to a wire --  Jesse hands the bag to Ellen Martin -- Dwayne scrutinizes Booth gets a glass of water and drinks it down --  Earl watches as Martin opens the bag --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right gentlemen -- maybe this will shed some light on what  took place. Martin rewinds the tape and we hear noise on the tape.  Dwayne is excited by the event, hoping to get some  answers -- he looks at Booth and Earl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kind of like those black boxes on the planes, you know, like the last seconds?  I figure most of what they hear is "AAAAAAAAAAAGH!" (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? Not amused, Booth and Earl force smiles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This just might be our ticket! Martin and Jesse look at Dwayne -- just then the tape  stops --  CLOSE on Booth, who looks as if he might start trembling Earl sniffs, tries to play it cool but there is real fear Martin looks at the two men for a beat, then --  CLOSE on Martin's thumb as she presses down the small PLA Dwayne perks up --  Jesse perks up --  Booth swallows hard --  Earl sniffs again -- the tape starts --  It is STATIC.  Martin lets it play for a while -- Dwayne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? Martin fast forwards -- more static --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's odd. Booth and Earl look at each other --  Martin fast forwards again -- static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the microphone was damaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks OK to me... Martin fast forwards again -- static.  She lets it play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well nothing audible to us.  Maybe the lab can pick something up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to have dragged you all  the way down here for that.  I  thought maybe it would help. Booth lets out an inaudible deep breath -- Earl immediate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What other leads did you come up with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too many.  But we're still  collecting evidence from the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we'd like to help you in any  way we can.  We're all in this  together, as law enforcement  officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We appreciate that. The tape continues to play static --

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Booth and Earl exit the coroner's office, into the busy h -- Earl gestures into the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be seeing you. Booth and Earl walk down the hallway, saying nothing unti

dialogues.speaker: EXT CENTRAL POLICE HEADQUARTERS
dialogues.text: The two men exit -- Booth leans against the wall and Earl his knees --  Soon Earl laughs weakly.  Booth does the same.  Soon they relief --  The two men look at each other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you doing tonight  partner? The two men laugh even harder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going out partner.  How 'bout  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: INT CROWDED BAR
dialogues.text: PAN a crowded bar --  MONTAGE of Earl living it up.  Music blares as he treats drinks, dances, lives it  up, all the time paying cash --

dialogues.speaker: EXT HOGAN HOUSE
dialogues.text: Long shot of the front of the house, somewhere in the cit is parked out front.

dialogues.speaker: INT HOGAN BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Dwayne is dressed in his bowling shirt, standing outside and his voice is soft and slightly slurred -- he pauses f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...I'm sorry.  Really I am. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't you open the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens, AND THERE IS SALLY.  She is hesitant, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd never do anything to hurt you.  You know that, right? Sally nods, her head slightly bowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just mind that sarcasm. and I'll mind my manners.  Deal? She nods again.  Satisfied, Dwayne reaches down, picks up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'll be back by 10, for the kiss-and-make-up part.  You don't have to wait up.  I'll wake ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, he's out the door.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HOGAN HOUSE
dialogues.text: Dwayne gets in his car, driving past a few others parked the headlights on one of the cars turn on, and it drives

dialogues.speaker: INT HOGAN LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Booth opens the door without knocking.  He carries a pack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally? There's no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally?  I was beginning to think he wasn't gonna leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s., cheery)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in here.

dialogues.speaker: INT HOGAN BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Booth enters, as Sally turns from the makeup mirror to gr and her smile hides it well. Booth holds out the package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me something?  What's the occasion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You deserve it is the occasion. Sally opens the box -- her eyes widen as she takes out se and expensive, LINGERIE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you I got hard in the  store thinking about you in these! Sally and Booth burst out laughing -- they kiss.   Booth looks hard into her eyes, and suddenly his expressi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your cheek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I...nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne got a little tipsy is all. He doesn't handle pressure well. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over. Booth's eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hell it's over.  You told me he wasn't doing this anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not, he's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booth.  Don't.  It's nothing. It's not worth it.  Remember what happened the last time? Booth looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not get into this again. I know him.  If you said something, he'd take it out on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'd take it out on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'd end up a widow in two ways.   (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's forget it.  I'll just be a little more careful  next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't gonna be a next time. We're gonna get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And go where?  He'd find me. I  know you don't think so, but he  would. Booth thinks for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we could go really, really far? Sally tries to put an end to it, with a change of tactic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to.  We've got everything we need right here. Sally wraps her arms around Booth, kissing him deeply.  T in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby...this must have been  expensive.  He doesn't want to give in, but Sally's made up her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're worth every last penny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't let you down now,  can I? Sally seductively touches his chest, and walks off with t

dialogues.speaker: INT HOGAN BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Booth sits on the edge of the bed, watching --  Sally comes out, dressed up in the sexy outfit: bra, pant Booth watches her as she approaches him --  She seductively straddles him, kisses him full on the lip frame -- Booth reacts accordingly at the right moment --

dialogues.speaker: INT HOGAN BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Booth is now on top, as the two go at it like animals, Sa They both climax, and Booth kisses Sally -- Sally looks a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne's gonna love me in this. Booth looks at her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a joke, silly. The two kiss some more -- soon the sound of VOICES rises

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you been lying there  playing possum with us, huh?   Answer me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll tell them everything to save  his ass. That's how they all work  it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It slowly gets louder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...no!  No way! That money is in  our  hands!  What did you hear!   How much did you hear!

dialogues.speaker: INT JESSE'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: PAN a dimly lit room, as the sounds of the voices get cle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna have to get rid of him. (coldly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not letting some gangbanger ruin my life.  We can't risk it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... As the camera continues to pan we see the voices are comi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're thinking about killing him. I can't do that.  No way.  I've never killed a man.  Never even shot at one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well neither have I, but it's us or him.  If he talks, or writes a  note        or whatever, he's gonna turn us  in.  Besides, he's just a low life  scumbag.  His kind is hardly even  human anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then.  I'll do it. Soon a hand approaches the recorder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen.  Do you want to go to jail? Taking evidence, tampering with a  crime scene.  You know what they'd  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would have done it to us, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  This is our little secret, partner. The hand shuts off the tape and we see the listener is  J look in his glassy eyes as he takes a swig of BOURBON --

dialogues.speaker: INT GARAGE
dialogues.text: The burned-out Mercedes sits in the center of the room -- Ellen Martin looks at it with forensic expert JOE WALLACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to hear the good news first, or the bad news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We retrieved a few things from the trunk, including a steamer trunk,  or the remnants of a trunk, the  brass clips and so forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money. Martin looks at Wallace --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But nowhere near three million dollars worth.  I would say maybe twenty thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bluntly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was more than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't tell us much. Did you run a check on the gas like I told you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we did.  It was unleaded, high octane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...what's the good news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car's a diesel.   Again, Martin looks at Wallace -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fire was set.  Deliberately. And probably not by anyone found at the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So someone did get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how else you'd explain it.  The coroner's estimated time of death for everyone there was long before this fire started, unless of course Denning started it, and that doesn't make much sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it doesn't.  Neither does his  blank tape.  Any news on that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing a check on the  manufacturers'        serial number, see  if there were other defective tapes  in the bunch. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your take on these local boys?  Are they providing any answers? Martin seems deep in thought -- a skeptical look crosses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I don't think they see much of this kind of thing. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they're going to.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF'S STATION
dialogues.text: Jesse looks out the window of the station --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose no man can judge another's actions unless he has been in the same situation himself, presented  with the same temptations. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And money sure is tempting.  Hell, some people will pretty much do  anything for money...lie, cheat,  steal, swindle... Jesse turns and looks --   Booth and Earl listen to him, grim expressions on their f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...kill. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't suppose it would be too  hard to kill a man, especially if  he's half dead, especially if he's  of the criminal persuasion. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know he was a federal  officer with a wife, and a baby on  the way? Earl and Booth say nothing.  Jesse laughs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gentlemen look like you're about to toss your collective cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you get to the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My point, well... Jesse gets up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey we're all friends, right?   Friends don't squeal on friends,  that's not what Jesse Segundo is  all about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what the hell are you all  about? Jesse looks hard at Earl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Earl.  I covered for you.   For both of you.  I put my ass on  the line to save yours, so don't pull a hostile tone with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your offer, Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My offer?  Well I'd say it's a fair one, like I said we're friends.  All I want is my share, which I guess is... Booth and Earl watch Jesse as he fast-forwards through th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's around here... Jesse then plays --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Two million eight hundred thousand sweet mother we're millionaires." Jesse clicks the tape off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll settle for a third of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if we refuse?  Your tampering  with evidence isn't exactly a  misdemeanor, did you ever consider  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True, but neither is attempted murder. In fact I'd say that's considerably worse, wouldn't you, Earl? Earl says nothing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I'm not stupid, Earl. The  tape was a basic Maxell D-80.  You  can buy 'em at any store.  There's  no way they can pin anything on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Jesse, we'll play it your way, under one condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to wait.  All of us,  until everything dies down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the deal.  If you don't  like it, forget it, no one wins. Jesse looks at Booth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok...I'll wait.  For now. But I'm going to need a little advance, to oil the wheels, so  to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pondering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand your logic, Booth,  but I don't think...two thousand's  going to raise any eyebrows, do  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two thousand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sternly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By Friday.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HOGAN HOUSE
dialogues.text: The lights are on in the house --

dialogues.speaker: INT HOGAN LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Holding a remote, Sally flips through the channels, stopp and Famous" type show --  POV of the television -- high-life on the Riviera --  Dwayne enters, popping open a can of BEER -- it overflows overflow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!  Did you drop these? Sally looks at him and then back at the screen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful not to get any on the  floor. Dwayne puts the beer on a table next to his chair --  Dwayne gingerly lowers himself into his chair, appearing Dwayne notices what's on TV and seems mildly disappointed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Sally watches the luxurious scenes on the TV --  DWAYNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this all that's on? She gets up and hands him the remote --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, watch what you want.  I'm  going to take a shower. Sally heads out of the room and Dwayne watches her leave takes another sip of his beer, shifts uncomfortably in hi

dialogues.speaker: INT HOGAN BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Having undressed, Sally wraps a towel around her and walk the sound of the shower begins --

dialogues.speaker: INT HOGAN LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Dwayne's hand flattening his empty beer can --  Dwayne belches loudly -- he then shifts in his chair agai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it. Dwayne gets up and walks offscreen into the kitchen, hold opening and closing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, where the hell is that thing...

dialogues.speaker: INT HOGAN BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Dwayne closes his closet door -- irritated, he goes to th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey where's the hot pad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the hot back -- the  therapeutic pad thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hear a word you're saying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. Dwayne checks in a dresser, then opens a closet, begins t Dwayne pulls out a CORD which is attached to a HOT PAD -- fall off the shelf onto the ground, including a SHOE BOX Dwayne looks at the ground --  A LACE STRAP pokes out of the box - Dwayne crouches down, slowly takes the lid off -- we hear Sally getting out of the  shower --  Dwayne lifts up the EXPENSIVE LINGERIE and looks at it wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?... He lifts up the individual garments, turning them around The bathroom door opens and Sally comes out in a towel an Dwayne, playing it cool - Dwayne looks back at her --  Sally approaches him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you digging around in my closet for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was looking for the hot pad! Sally goes to grab the lingerie out of Dwayne's hand -- h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mind telling me where the hell this came from?  (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something I don't know  about?  Sally looks Dwayne in the eye and fights to be casual, ac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Dwayne looks hard at her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean are you spending my money on other things I don't know about?  Got any furs in there? Mildly relieved, Sally grabs the lingerie out of Dwayne's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be ridiculous!  It wasn't so expensive! Sally puts the box back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was going to be a surprise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A surprise huh?  Well I don't like  any surprises, especially if  I'm forking over the loot for  them! Sally closes the door and looks at him for a beat before from him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a real smooth talker, you know that? Sally goes to the mirror and combs her hair out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying you're about as romantic  as a bag of sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (menacing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch that.  Watch that tone. Dwayne looks at her with a surly but suspicious expressio exchange and leaves with his hot pad.  When he's gone, Sally looks at herself in the mirror with

dialogues.speaker: EXT TRAILER HOME
dialogues.text: Booth and Earl's PATROL CAR is parked next to the trailer

dialogues.speaker: EXT BURIAL SITE ABOVE BOOTH'S TRAILER
dialogues.text: Standing in front of where the money is buried, Booth cro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could kill that no good son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right enough!  I'm tired of  thinking about all this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm not! (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinks he's got us by the balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well doesn't he?  Besides if the DEA heard that tape we'd be behind bars right now.  Just call it the cost of doing business. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole thing is screwed up. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking.  Maybe we should tell 'em the truth... Earl gives Booth a "get real" look. Incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Or get rid of the money.  I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a better idea.  All we  have to do is straighten out Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how do you figure we do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we have to do is get our hands on the original tape.  We'll set  him up somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's probably made copies.  He's not  going to give them up to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the copies!  He could have  made up the copies -- the only  thing that incriminates us is the  original. Booth rifles through the bag --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to be trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a partner now, Earl, like it  or not. Earl looks around --  Booth inspects the money, then looks up at Earl -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been back here? Earl looks at him for a beat, guiltily -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I just took a little out.   I'm keeping track of it, you can trust me. Booth gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a deal!  What was I,  talking to the wall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake, Booth, I just  needed to take care of a few debts is all!  You  got my word on it --I'm not going near it  again until everything cools down. Booth looks at Earl for a beat, then proceeds to take out before hastily sealing up the  bag --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said that last time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I mean it this time. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Let's get this over  with! The men begin to fill the hole with dirt --

dialogues.speaker: EXT WALKING PATH
dialogues.text: Booth and Sally walk slowly, and close together, down a r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him I bought the lingerie,  as a surprise.  I don't think he suspects anything, but now you know, if he mentions it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell did he find it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He started digging through my  closet, something he never does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK, Booth, it's no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he asks me again, I'm gonna tell him I returned it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, I'm so sick of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every night I think about you sleeping with him, him slobbering all over you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't slobber, he just snores. And I told you we haven't...done  anything in over a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter...he's next to  you. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I always say to myself,  you should have left him years ago. Why didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to think he was something, once... (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was eighteen, I didn't know any better, and he had something  steady to offer. Booth shakes his head to himself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get into a routine, after a few years, when the thrill was gone, I just said to myself this is my destination, I guess. Sally looks at Booth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I met you. Booth looks back at her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just get out of here, get  out of this -- place.  We'll drop  out, get a house have some kids,  get a satellite dish...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate it when you talk like this. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd... I don't know...go to  California, New York, maybe a  house on a Swiss mountainside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd have to be Switzerland to  make sure Dwayne never finds us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it takes... Sally stops walking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's got into you? Booth notices Sally has stopped walking -- he stops and l arrange his thoughts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm bored, you know?  I'm  frustrated.  I want it to work  for us. Sally approaches him, and they embrace --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. They kiss -- Sally puts her head on his shoulder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to figure it out.  It won't be long. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. They kiss again, and Booth puts his arm around her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A satellite dish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I was just throwing out  ideas... They walk down the lane, saying nothing --

dialogues.speaker: EXT VEGAS STRIP
dialogues.text: MONTAGE of all the casinos, the crowds, the glitter -

dialogues.speaker: EXT RESORT
dialogues.text: At the entrance of one casino, people are seen pulling up luggage, leaving and arriving -  Slowly a figure emerges from the crowd, alone, walking de walks into the harsh sunlight, oblivious to the people ar exhausted -- He squints from the glare, puts on his sunglasses and loo He stands there for a beat, then lets out a prolonged, de His PAGER goes off - Jesse reads the number -

dialogues.speaker: EXT PAYPHONE
dialogues.text: Jesse wipes down his forehead with one hand and digs in h he comes up with a measly handful of change and stuffs it he picks up the phone and dials the operator -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna make a collect call...

dialogues.speaker: INT SHERIFF'S STATION
dialogues.text: Dwayne approaches a phone -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Line six, chief... Dwayne presses the appropriate extension and picks up the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah whaddya want?.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you calling collect for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at a payphone in Vegas.  What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vegas!  Can you hightail it back  here by three o'clock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we got the DEA coming down here again, I don't know, sounds to me like they got some more questions they want to ask us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well they really didn't go into any details on the phone, but they did ask for you, and I  figure we should try to help them out as best we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat, looks around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, sure.  I hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So be here at three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do my best...that doesn't give me much time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I  have complete faith in you.   But don't you go speeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...see you at three. Jesse hangs up the phone with a concerned expression on h

dialogues.speaker: EXT EARL'S MOTHER'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: A car pulls up and Earl gets out in front of the small La mail out of the box and approaches the modest house -- he in --

dialogues.speaker: INT EARL'S MOTHER'S KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Earl walks in with the mail -- Earl's MOTHER is washing d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. She turns off the water and dries her hands --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the mail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Earl's mother inspects the mail -- she seems disappointed Earl's mother drops the mail on the counter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, same ol' same ol'. Earl pours himself a glass of MILK from out of the refrig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People have been asking me about that story in the paper.  I told them you were the first person on the scene.  They were asking me for all the details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was pretty gory ma, let me tell you.  But you have to turn all that off, and do your job, just  like pop used to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they ever find out who they were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. If you're a criminal you don't carry ID, and if you do you're a damn fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you this world just keeps getting more and more violent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least around here it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (goes to pantry) Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah sure I'll grab something  before I go... (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- I've got a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do? Earl takes a sip of his milk, then smiles at his mother -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to see it?

dialogues.speaker: INT EARL'S MOTHER'S LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Earl carries a large, heavy BOX through the front door an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Earl stands up, stretches his lower back -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was this raffle going on  at the station, some charity or church was running it, I forget, so I figure what the hell put in my five bucks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well basically I forgot about it, you know, you never win these things, but this time, well...  Earl rips the paper off the box to reveal a large WINDOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won! Earl's mother heads over to him, looking at the box --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what do you know!  An air conditioner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And not just any air conditioner. This baby sells for over six hundred dollars retail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great Earl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, fifteen thousand BTU's,  enough to cool off this whole  place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Figured you could have it. Earl's mother stares at him for a beat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, hell I'll get one soon enough.  Besides, I want you  to have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done without it long enough,  ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl picks up his milk glass -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like the commercial says, you deserve a break today... He takes a swig of milk --  Earl's mother looks at the air conditioner, pleasantly su

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can put it in the living room window... (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great Earl.  Earl's mother hugs him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you honey.  are you sure you don't want it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely positively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will certainly be an improvement... (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: what was the charity again? Earl sets the glass on a table --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.  But I'm glad I  gave it a shot.

dialogues.speaker: INT SHERIFF'S STATION
dialogues.text: Dwayne looks at his watch -- 3:25 --  Martin, Booth, Earl, and Dwayne sit in the station --  Suddenly Jesse walks through the door, with an ashen expr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice of you to join us.  I did say         three o'clock, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm here now. Booth and Earl react to Jesse's expression as he sits  down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to meet with you all to go over some new information about the murders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find a suspect? Martin looks at Jesse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think I would have told you that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We discovered something interesting  about the tape Denning was wearing. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Based on the serial number, we've  determined that the tape was  purchased locally. Jesse swallows.  Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's odd.  I don't know how Denning had the time, or the ability to buy something local, based on his situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I suppose you would know more about his situation than us. Martin stares at Earl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  Maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you getting at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, unfortunately Denning's not here to tell us, but I would say someone got their hands on that tape and switched it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would someone do that?
