dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they don't want anyone to hear what's on it, obviously.   Martin looks directly at Jesse -- Dwayne turns and does t Jesse looks at them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, like you said, he's not here to tell us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true...that's true. Just then Martin's beeper goes off -- she reads it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I have to make a phone call. Martin goes over to a phone --  Dwayne looks at Jesse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong, Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Something wrong with you Dwayne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You walked in here looking like  you just ate a shit sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just got a lot of things  on my mind is all. Dwayne shrugs and looks at Booth and Earl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think about all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I don't know.  If I had  some input I'd offer it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta roll anyhow.  How long is  this going to take? Martin hangs up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatsamatter with you?  Aren't you  concerned about all of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get enough of it. Martin approaches the men as Booth and Earl get up -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else we can do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I wanted to ask you a few more questions, but I have to go.         I'm sorry. Martin looks at Jesse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right behind you. Booth, Earl, and Jesse all head out --  Martin watches them leave -- Dwayne addresses her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just got started, where you headed off to? Martin continues to watch the men leave, then turns her a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that was Agent Wallace.  We're going to check into something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should come along. Martin appears reluctant for a moment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have to be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell no. besides I'm just a radio  call away if something happens. I feel I should keep abreast of what happens, seeing it's my jurisdiction and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, agent Martin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen... (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you might think this is a small town, and we do things a  certain way, but I don't want you to confuse that with...a lack of resolve. Dwayne's expression becomes more determined -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like people getting away from me, and I'm prepared to  scour the earth for whoever did it. I want you to know that. Martin and Dwayne look at each other for a beat - Martin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, sure.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: EXT SHERIFF'S STATION
dialogues.text: Booth and Earl exit and Jesse approaches them from behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me at the Tumbleweed Diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it!  Meet me there, now. Booth and Earl watch Jesse as he makes a beeline for his  car --

dialogues.speaker: INT "TUMBLEWEED" DINER
dialogues.text: PAN the local diner --  Jesse drags on a cigarette and faces Booth and Earl as th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's going to have to be a change in our arrangement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you proposing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my share. All of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. Jesse takes another drag and stares hard at Earl -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you're not getting, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen - Jesse looks around the diner --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like getting grilled by that DEA bitch, I don't like taking that kind of heat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of us like it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't know what's going  to happen next -- she's pressing  this, another interrogation,  another problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take it in stride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna take --          (beat, quieter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna take it in stride. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a good run turn to shit on me like that -  (snaps finger hard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cleaned me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  You gambled it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was on a roll!  IГ­m a little overextended now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I want the money and I want it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you can't have it. Jesse stares at Earl with a mixture of desperation and ir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...I can turn that tape over to Martin and come out smelling  like a rose, you understand that  Earl?  So I'm going to make you a  final proposition.  I want two  million dollars tonight, or the  tape goes into her hands tomorrow morning. Booth and Earl stare at Jesse for a beat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mean you're coming unglued,  Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to see how more unglued I can get?  Try me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're never getting that much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I am.         Jesse gets up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you until nine o'clock tonight to bring it to my house. Jesse look at the table --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope you don't mind picking up  the tab. Booth and Earl watch Jesse storm off --

dialogues.speaker: EXT STREET
dialogues.text: A patrol car zooms down the road --

dialogues.speaker: INT PATROL CAR
dialogues.text: Booth drives and Earl looks out the window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's bluffing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do I. Earl sighs loudly and looks out the window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Earl.  We gotta go straight.   This is all messed up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're any friend at all, you'll  stop talking like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we can reason with Jesse, give  him a third in exchange for the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he's going to be doing any bargaining with us, the stupid son-of-a-bitch!  Besides, I'm not giving him a third of anything, not after everything we had to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what are we supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...we have to shut  him up somehow. Booth looks at Earl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's a reckless guy, Booth.   Got a lot of monkeys on his back. Who knows, maybe it all catches  up with him somehow. Booth realizes what Earl is saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How badly do you want that money?!  How bad do you want to stay out of jail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad enough to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said anything about killing? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep driving straight...

dialogues.speaker: EXT ROAD
dialogues.text: The car drives down the street --

dialogues.speaker: EXT BANK
dialogues.text: Establish the bank, with a patrol car in front --

dialogues.speaker: INT BANK
dialogues.text: Martin, Wallace, and Dwayne are in a room with the bank m On a table are three HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Curtis called us this afternoon. The bills arrived at this branch from a cash drop.  Came through a store called After Midnight.  There's only four employees, none of them can tell us who passed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this marked money, or what? Dwayne looks at Martin and Wallace --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of it.  Denning only handled a small portion of the total, but it looks like this was one of his  bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there was money there!  Who the hell's money is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know.  Whoever got this payload together has one hell of a laundering system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you known this all along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you can understand why we didn't say anything.  If word got out that we had a track on the money it would only work  against us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well yes I understand that, we don't want them high-tailing it out of here. Martin then looks at Dwayne --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Hogan --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne... (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is imperative that we keep  this confidential.        Now we know  someone's out there.  Very close.  It may even be the son of a bitch  that killed my partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  The information doesn't leave  this room. Martin looks at the bank manager -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna say anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- this is confidential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK...this is good.  Our first solid lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say After Midnight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that, some kind of porno store or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly.  It's some lingerie  store on the strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lingerie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, racy stuff, you know the  kind, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure...

dialogues.speaker: EXT HOGAN HOUSE
dialogues.text: The lights are on inside --

dialogues.speaker: INT HOGAN LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Dwayne and Sally face each other, eating at a table --  Nothing is said for a considerable length, Dwayne focused occasionally looking up at Dwayne --  Soon Sally puts her fork down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right what's the matter? Dwayne looks up, then back at his plate --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  Nothing's the matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to tell how your day went?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much to tell.  Nothing really happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That hasn't stopped you before. Dwayne looks up at her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny... Dwayne resumes eating --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose I'm not exciting enough for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that.  You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you might as well say it. Mister Small Time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just trying to be civil Dwayne. Dwayne continues eating --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to hear about my day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah let's hear about your day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I got the tires rotated, I went shopping, and I made dinner. Dwayne doesn't respond --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a flying saucer landed in the  backyard, aliens abducted me,  performed experiments, and let me  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it sounds like you had quite a full day. Dwayne keeps looking at his plate -- Sally looks at him up, taking her plate --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look I worked all day, I'm tired as hell and I want to sit and eat in peace!  Is that asking too much? Sally turns and faces him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dwayne, you go ahead and relax, have a six pack and fall asleep in front of the TV, and come upstairs and pass out.  And do it all over again tomorrow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save me the sermon.  I've heard it all before, it's boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It certainly is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne watches her leave --

dialogues.speaker: EXT JESSE'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Booth and Earl approach the door, Booth carrying a bag. pair of latex gloves out of his pocket.  He hands a pair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.  He'll freak when he sees this.

dialogues.speaker: INT JESSE'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Jesse takes a swig of booze out of an old glass --  The door knocks and Jesse goes to answer it -- he looks t POV Booth and Earl are outside. Jesse smiles and opens the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was beginning to think you weren't going to show. (looking at bag)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That can't be all of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It's not. Booth and Earl walk in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's...what's with the gloves? Earl pulls out his service revolver and aims it at Jesse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Jesse. Jesse stares at Booth and Earl in stunned silence -- he l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this. Jesse ignores the request, pouring himself another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I had a feeling you just might pull something like this,  some hard-ass tactic. Jesse takes another swig and looks at them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think I'd be prepared? Earl and Booth stare at Jesse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Jesse. Jesse stares back at them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to shoot me. Earl looks at him, then puts his revolver back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I guess I can't. Booth and Earl then GRAB Jesse -- Jesse struggles as they

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing, you  crazy some bitches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna talk. They drag him up on his feet, over to a METAL OFFICE CHAI Booth gets out some CUFFS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't suppose you'll tell us where the tape is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's not here -- you're wasting your time and you're pissing me off! As Earl restrains Jesse, Booth takes one cuff and clamps the arm of the chair -- Jesse winces in pain --  Earl then quickly jams a wooden STICK between JesseГ­s te ends tightly around the back of JesseГ­s head -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell!!! Earl goes over to the bag and pulls out some LAMP CORD wh Booth takes the cord and quickly begins to secure Jesse t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what the hell you're doing but you're as good as dead now! Spittle runs down JesseГ­s chin -  Earl continues to rummage thought the bag -- he pulls out plastic and sets them on a table --   Jesse watches Earl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this shit! Earl reaches for Jesse's pack of cigarettes on the table, hrows them on the table -- he fumbles in his pockets and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the only person I know on Earth who smokes this bullshit brand! Jesse looks on as Earl lights up the cigarette and begins revealing first a SPOON, which he places on the table, th white plastic bottle, labeled POTASSIUM -  A look of genuine concern crosses JesseГ­s face as he see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anything happens to me I got  people who'll go straight --  (struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: straight to a safety deposit box  and they'll find out everything! Booth continues to tie up Jesse as he and Earl look at ea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't expect us to believe that do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better believe it if you know what's good for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that's the problem with you. You got a big mouth.  A big fat mouth. Earl takes a spoonful of potassium and holds a LIGHTER ov lavender smoke to rise as the potassium liquefies -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me out of this!  Get me out of this asshole!!  You try anything, you'll leave a thousand clues.  We find 'em all the time.   We're trained for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are we, Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse begins to struggle wildly, kicking fiercely -- Boot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit settle him down! Booth fights to do so -- he stares at Earl --  Earl fills the syringe, hands beginning to shake as he li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long is it going to take?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!  Shit, give me a  break!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH!!!! Jesse and the chair hit the ground.  His face i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Booth.  Don't let him  do this!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't have much choice, Jesse. You saw to that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're only screwing yourselves over! (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helllllp! (louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the top of his lungs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's gonna hear you, Jesse.   We're in the middle of nowhere! Earl approaches with the menacing needle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, get him up, all right? Booth struggles and fails to pull Jesse up -- Earl puts d they stand Jesse upright --  Jesse is almost in tears now, blood seeps from a cut on h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta, Jesse.  It's tough, but you didn't leave us any choice.  We gotta know where the tapes are. Earl brings the needle over...he begins to bring it towar Jesse is coming unglued - Earl stares at him hard -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy to purchase, hard to detect. Too much potassium can kill a man. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just have to...pick a discreet spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!  Stop!  I don't need the  money.  You can have it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the tape?  Where are the copies? Jesse looks down as the needle enters his mouth, just und

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not convinced... Earl then STABS the needle under JesseГ­s tongue - Jesse apprehension -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, Earl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Earl? Earl looks at Jesse, then back at Booth - he then removes Suddenly, Booth slams Earl against the wall - Earl's ciga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you thinking? (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were only supposed to scare him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just making our intentions  clear. Go check the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I'm telling the truth! Booth pulls the cassette from the bottom, held there by m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is...now what about the others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no others, Goddammit!                 Earl turns and smiles at Jesse -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better safe than sorry. Earl then rapidly and unexpectedly STABS the needle under contents -  Jesse screams, then after a second - he JOLTS VIOLENTLY -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl!!!  Booth pulls Earl away, but it's too late.  The syringe is Jesse JOLTS violently again, and CRASHES to the floor -  The two men stare at Jesse in shocked silence -  Jesse exhales one final time, a death gasp from his open, Booth looks at Earl with a mixture of shock and terror -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had no choice. Booth says nothing -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that.  Deep down, you  know it.   Booth then turns and looks at Jesse -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if we have the tape, that  wouldn't shut him up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be o.k.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hell it is.  This is Jesse! Jesse! Jesse's eyes dilate.  His head rocks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know there's no other way. Earl stands back.  Booth backs away in horror, sweat runn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?  What's happening to us?? Booth runs his hand through his hair, turns to the window

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...stupid.... Booth then turns and SHOVES Earl violently across the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch! Booth looks around and heads out the front door --  Earl gets up and follows him -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booth steps out to the porch, feeling his chest as if sic GRABS HIM, spins him around -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! Booth shoves him back, and the two men square off -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't start losing it on me Booth!   Do you understand what I'm saying! Booth stares at Earl for a beat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ Earl...what are we doing?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing what we gotta do, to protect ourselves!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know if he was really  gonna --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I DO!  It never woulda stopped, you know that.  Jesse's always gonna be making mistakes and we'd be paying for them for the rest of our lives. Earl grabs Booth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you have to get it under control. We gotta get out of here, we gotta  set him up just right and you can't come apart on me now! Booth takes a very deep breath --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now are you under control? Booth looks at Earl, fighting to maintain composure --

dialogues.speaker: INT JESSE'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Jesse's lifeless eyes stare into the camera, his mouth ag saliva -- the camera stays with him for a long moment, pu can be heard is the ticking of a CLOCK-  Booth and Earl look down at the body saying nothing -- th long moment --  We see all three men, motionless, Booth and Earl standing CLOSE ON JESSE'S MOUTH as Booth removes the gag -  Together, Earl and Booth carefully remove the handcuffs a Earl stands the chair up --  Booth and Earl look down at Jesse --  Earl takes Jesse's hand and pulls it out above him --  He grabs the whiskey glass and places it near Jesse's han ground --  Booth scoops up the items on the table --   Booth turns the TV on with the sound off -- Earl watches Booth stuffs the lamp cord back into the bag --  Earl and Booth look at Jesse --  Jesse lies on the ground, appearing to have collapsed on Earl and Booth look at him.  They look guilty as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should say somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Booth grabs the bag --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure as hell hope so. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Booth and earl do a final check of the room --  Booth opens the front door and turns the inside lock --  Together the men take one last look, then exit - The door closes - CAMERA PANS over, down, across the floor, and settling on It is Earl's empty cigarette pack --

dialogues.speaker: EXT STREET
dialogues.text: A patrol car zooms down the road --

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR
dialogues.text: Dwayne drives down the road with a preoccupied look on hi heartbreak plays on the radio - POV the car passes signs indicating Las Vegas is a few mi

dialogues.speaker: EXT VEGAS STRIP MALL
dialogues.text: The patrol car pulls up -- one of the stores listed is AF

dialogues.speaker: EXT AFTER MIDNIGHT
dialogues.text: Dwayne looks in the window, displaying an assortment of S the window, puts on his aviator SUNGLASSES and heads in -

dialogues.speaker: INT AFTER MIDNIGHT
dialogues.text: Dwayne heads into the store -- a female SALESPERSON smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Dwayne plays it casual, looking at the assortment of bras sheer bathrobes, etc., etc... The salesperson approaches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything I can help you with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I just uh, you know... Dwayne faces her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an anniversary coming up, thought I'd buy her something  special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything...specific?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't know... Dwayne laughs nervously, gesturing to a garment that leav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, how much is something like that? The salesperson checks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is...65 dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty five... (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez Louise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are having a sale on some items over here --  The go to a rack marked SALE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know her sizes? The question catches Dwayne off guard -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, well I don't know her specific sizes... The salesperson patiently smiles --  Dwayne pulls out his wallet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I can give you an idea... He produces a PHOTOGRAPH of Sally -- hands it to the sale

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pretty... Dwayne looks at the picture as if he hadn't thought it in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she is.  She comes up to about here on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't suppose you've seen her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I seen her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shopping here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't say that I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Dwayne puts the photo back -- the salesperson looks at th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see...do you know her cup size?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...C?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I'd say C...C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know...34 C?  32 C?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I don't.   (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you havenГ­t seen her? The salesperson smiles and shakes her head politely, take

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I should have done a  little homework, getting all  the sizes, and what not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just not very good...with all  of this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's ok, a lot of men feel uncomfortable when they come in  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of men come in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.  Between here and Vegas we get a lot of customers.  All types. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even had an officer, just like you. Dwayne looks at the salesperson -

dialogues.speaker: INT ELECTRONICS STORE
dialogues.text: It is a clearance warehouse -- a CLERK stands behind a co him  -- the clerk is holding a PICTURE of Jesse Segundo -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I've seen him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he buy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.  We get a lot of people in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could it have been this? She hands over a 3-pack of Maxell cassette tapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time he was  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too long ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be more specific.  A month, a week...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week ago, at most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your time. Martin heads out, Wallace watches her, and follows -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa...whoa... The clerk watches them leave, totally confused --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- hey what's this all about!

dialogues.speaker: EXT ROAD
dialogues.text: An UNMARKED CAR is parked by the side of the road.  Walla

dialogues.speaker: INT UNMARKED CAR
dialogues.text: Martin is in the driver seat, as Wallace climbs back in. They begin driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't make it into work, and  he's not home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it, I knew it all along - shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he skipped town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to find out.

dialogues.speaker: INT SHERIFF'S STATION
dialogues.text: Earl walks in alone.  Nobody is in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne?  Trudy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne's not here, Earl. He went down to the bank with those government people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  That's what he said. Earl bites his lip.

dialogues.speaker: EXT DIRT ROAD
dialogues.text: Dwayne drives up the dirt road toward Booth's trailer, st out of trailer's line of sight. He begins to walk toward the trailer, cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Booth and Sally sit and face one another  --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we going to do all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to quit.  That's what has to happen first.  Then we're going to tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there for you.  He won't try anything while I'm there. (taking her hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.  I'll protect you.

dialogues.speaker: EXT TRAILER
dialogues.text: Dwayne has made it to where he can see the trailer.  He l POV Sally's car, parked around the corner of the trailer. Dwayne clenches his jaw, fighting to contain his rage.   He turns around and heads back toward his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do you expect this  inheritance stuff to be  straightened out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't be long.  A couple  of weeks maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you rely on how much they  said you'd get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be more than enough.  We can get out of here...

dialogues.speaker: INT JESSE'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: WHAM!!! Wallace kicks the door open and he and Martin rus They freeze when they see Jesse on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit... Jesse stares blankly through glazed eyes --  Martin goes over to the body and checks Jesse's wrist --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he dead? Martin feels Jesse's neck for a pulse and realizes it's f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?  Heart attack? Martin inspects the ABRASIONS on Jesse's wrist -- then lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...   Martin looks for the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Sheriff Hogan down here,  somebody, anybody let's lock  it down here. Wallace goes to the phone and dials -- Martin looks aroun the scene -- he then inspects the puncture mark on Jesse's arm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not getting an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not getting an answer?  For  Christ's sake!  Call 911!  Let's get it locked down here!         Wallace hangs up and dials 911 --  Martin crouches down and inspects the wound on Jesse's fo head and sighs, frustrated --  Something then catches her eye in the corner --  She gets up, walks over to it, crouches down, and picks i It is Earl's empty cigarette pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace?  Get over here. Wallace looks at the pack with Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take Jesse's car outside. Head to the station, detain Deputy Whitney if he's there. I'll go to his apartment.

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Booth is looking intently at Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does that bother you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure why.  It's just,  I've never been anywhere else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally there's a whole world out  there.  We can have a new home.   A real home, not some tin-plated  dump.  What are you giving up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  My friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll meet new people. You might  have friends out there you never  met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess you're right. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just...all so sudden...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is... All of a sudden, THE PHONE BEGINS RINGING. Booth heads into the living room --

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Booth picks up the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booth.  We got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: INT CAR TRUNK
dialogues.text: The blackness of the trunk is turned momentarily to light Dwayne, reaching in.   He pulls out a shotgun, lowers the trunk, and shuts it qu

dialogues.speaker: EXT DIRT ROAD- DAY
dialogues.text: Dwayne heads toward the trailer, gun in hand.

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Booth talks on the phone -- Sally listens in the  background --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, traceable?

dialogues.speaker: INT SHERIFF'S STATION
dialogues.text: Earl is speaking with Booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know for sure, but why else would they head for the bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was all used.  Random numbers.   How can they trace it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  They got all kinds of high-tech shit nowadays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we're screwed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we're not.

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Sally listens into the conversation --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not?  How do you figure  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take the money and disappear!   We can do it, spend it on the move.   Even if all of it's marked, there's  ways around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to go now, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Sally comes too. Earl thinks for a second --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Sally comes too. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right there.  You just hang tight, partner.

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Booth hangs up the phone, turns to see Sally looking at h to her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you wanna tell me what that was all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I want to tell you  everything.

dialogues.speaker: EXT SHERIFF'S STATION
dialogues.text: Earl jumps into his car, peels out of the lot.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Earl goes ripping past.

dialogues.speaker: INT JESSE'S CAR
dialogues.text: Wallace sees Earl approaching, from the opposite directio

dialogues.speaker: INT EARL'S CAR
dialogues.text: Earl recognizes Jesse's car --

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Earl's car passes the vehicle at a high speed --

dialogues.speaker: INT EARL'S CAR
dialogues.text: Earl looks in the rearview mirror --  POV MIRROR -- Wallace does a SCREECHING U-TURN. Earl panics, and PUNCHES IT --

dialogues.speaker: EXT ROAD
dialogues.text: Earl's car ZOOMS down the road-  Wallace follows --

dialogues.speaker: INT EARL'S CAR
dialogues.text: Earl looks in his rearview mirror --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Earl steps on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: INT JESSE'S CAR
dialogues.text: Wallace pastes it to the floor, in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: EXT TRAILER HOME
dialogues.text: Dwayne heads to the front door -- listens in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things just got a little screwed up, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to you, it's true...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll disappear and he'll be out of our lives forever. Sally grapples to put it all in perspective -- she shakes know what to say -- Booth approaches her, gently puts his hands on her should her eyes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally, do you love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I do. Booth's lips get closer to Sally's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then take this chance. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it with me... The two begin to kiss --

dialogues.speaker: EXT TRAILER HOME
dialogues.text: An enraged Dwayne can no longer control himself -- he pee window -- POV Booth and Sally kiss passionately -- Dwayne storms toward the front door and SMASH -- KICKS it

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Booth freezes -- Dwayne stares at them -- they stare back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm gonna be sick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now just take it easy Dwayne --  Dwayne pulls out his revolver -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut your mouth you son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne put the gun down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!!!  Slut!!! Dwayne heads over to her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd do this to me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd do this to me! CRACK!!!  Dwayne backhands Sally hard across the mouth -- Booth springs toward Dwayne, who aims his gun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!  Come on scumbag!   Sally gets up, bleeding from the mouth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put...the gun...down... Dwayne is trembling with rage.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Earl has the car floored at 110 mph, with Wallace right b He almost skids off the road as they round a turn, dust f wake behind him. Wallace closes in.

dialogues.speaker: INT EARL'S CAR
dialogues.text: Earl's eyes are glued to the rear view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  Shit shit shit!

dialogues.speaker: INT JESSE'S CAR
dialogues.text: Wallace closes in.  He reaches under his arm, pulls out a it into his left hand, driving with the right. Tries to aim, unsteadily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne is seething.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should kill you right here! I never thought you'd do this to me but I guess there's a lot I didn't know about you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne listen to me -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!  Not another word out of you!  You're going down, the Feds know all about it!  You didn't know some of it was marked, did you!   Where's the rest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enraged)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne please calm down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down --  BLAM BLAM!!!  Booth and Sally cringe as Dwayne fires arou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that                           How's that for  calm

dialogues.speaker: THE MUZZLE OF A GUN
dialogues.text: -- as it goes off.  BLAM!

dialogues.speaker: INT EARL'S CAR
dialogues.text: The back window BLOWS OUT.  BLAM BLAM BLAM!  Wallace's ot

dialogues.speaker: INT JESSE'S CAR
dialogues.text: Wallace fights for aim, using his left hand.

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: BLAM!  Dwayne fires again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that, you --  POW!  Dwayne punches Sally across the face --  Booth SPRINGS on Dwayne -- the men CRASH around the room Booth STRUGGLES for the gun --  WHAM!  WHAM! Booth cracks Dwayne's hand against the dress Sally stumbles to her feet, heads toward the men --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!   Stop!!! The two men whirl around - Dwayne FIRES --

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: The bullet RIPS into Sally's chest and she slams into the Booth SMASHES Dwayne's arm against the wall -- he drops t rattles across the ground into the living room --

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Booth and Dwayne begin to fight ferociously, fists flying for the gun.  It goes skittering down further across the Dwayne POUNDS Booth in the face, SLAMMING him back into t the trailer -- Dwayne heads for the gun --

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Booth shakes it off, is about to follow, when he looks to Opens it.  His revolver is there --

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Dwayne REACHES for the gun, checks the load.  He stands u it around, and --  BLAM!  A bullet RIPS through Dwayne's forehead --  He falls back and his head hits the ground -- Booth holds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl reaches across the seat, for the glove compartment. BLAM! A bullet whizzes through the headrest where Earl's He comes back up, but only then sees the turnoff for Boot He whips the wheel around, and -- -- Earl loses control of the car.

dialogues.speaker: EXT ROADWAY
dialogues.text: Earl skids, braking sharply into the dust at the side of cloud of dust follows behind him.

dialogues.speaker: INT JESSE'S CAR
dialogues.text: Wallace follows close behind, into the cloud, when -- WALLACE'S POV of Earl's car DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF HIM! Wallace JERKS the wheel around in the nick of time, skitt the side of Earl's car --

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: -- and INTO THE AIR, off the embankment at the side of th Wallace is AIRBORNE, plummeting down, hood first, into th His car EXPLODES in a HUGE BALL OF FLAME.

dialogues.speaker: INT EARL'S CAR
dialogues.text: Earl sees this, grimaces, and puts the car back into gear toward Booth's trailer. The dust rises behind him as he drives up toward Booth, a

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Booth staggers into the room, dropping the gun, horrified moves over to Sally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally!  Oh my God, oh my God --  Sally wheezes, in the throes of death, bleeding profusely her firmly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't die on me, don't die on me, don't die on me --  She tries to speak, but can't.  She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Earl opens the door --  Dwayne stares up at him, his head resting in a pool of  blood. Earl bites his lip. He sees Dwayne's gun on the floor, then hears Booth's cri He heads toward the bedroom, toward the sound.

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Booth cradles Sally, whose shirt is soaked in blood --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inconsolable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed her...he killed her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?  What's Earl doing  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He found us, he shot her...he killed her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booth, listen to me...Booth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed her... Earl goes over to Booth -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got to get out of here.  Do you understand?  We got to get  out of here right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It stops now.  It stops here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  We can make still make it work.   Earl pauses, his mind racing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know.  Dwayne's dead,  but we can deal with it.   (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll pin it on him.   (thinking faster)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DEA was driving Jesse's car.   No car phone.  No radio.  They  couldn't have called me in. He picks up Booth's gun with a finger.  Holds it out to B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll look like Dwayne killed them,  then came to kill you, too.  Self -  defense.  Sally just got caught up  in it. Booth refuses to take the gun. Earl drops it to the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne had the opportunity, just  like us.  He was at the scene.  He  grabbed the cash.  Of course. (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is perfect! Booth suddenly stands, grabbing Earl's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you nuts?  Sally's dead! Dwayne's dead.  Jesse's dead! There's no walking away from this! It is OVER!  Do you hear me? Earl isn't fazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll need the money. And with that, Earl is out of the door, headed down the h Booth waits a beat, looks down to the floor, grabs up his He follows Earl.

dialogues.speaker: INT TRAILER LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Earl grabs the shovel on the way, looks up at the burial above.  Booth is right behind. POV of the burial site, from down below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's NOT too late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is.  I'm calling it  in.  Right now. Booth picks up the phone with his free hand.  This stops Booth is pointing the gun at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been making the wrong moves all along. It's time to make the  right one. Earl replies, gesturing out the window, toward the hill w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who's nuts! There's no one left to touch us, Booth.  We're home free!  We just plant a little of the money on Dwayne, and it's all ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about the money anymore. Can't you see that?  It's about the lies.  The lies, Earl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one more.  This one knocks off all the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.  I can't go on.  I can't keep lying...killing.  That's not me.  That's not US. Booth stands his ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna shoot me, partner?  Is that what you're gonna do? Booth considers for a moment.  Drops his gun to his side, onto the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not.  The killing stops  here. Earl turns to look up the hill, as Booth continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do what you gotta do,  Earl.  You take it all if you want.  But I'm going in. Earl turns to look at his partner for a long beat.   He turns his head again.  Looks up the hill, to where the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll bring me down, too. Eventually.  You gotta know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're solid on that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rock solid. Then Earl picks up Dwayne's gun in one quick motion, and Booth doesn't flinch. Booth looks Earl straight in the eye.  Almost nods. Earl can't do it.  He looks at his partner, grits his tee the gun down, then --

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: A bullet BLASTS through Booth's chest -- he flies back -- sends him to the ground --  BLAM!!! Earl finishes Booth off with a shot to the head - Earl wipes off the gun, almost crying now. He places it in Dwayne's hand --  Earl surveys the carnage around the room for a beat.  Han

dialogues.speaker: EXT TRAILER HOME
dialogues.text: Earl trudges up the hill, toward the money.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: A highway patrol car is next to the smoking wreck of Jess looks down on the scene. Martin approaches in her car.  She runs over, flashing he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, ma'am. She looks down to the tire tracks, which pull off the roa Booth's trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer, follow me.

dialogues.speaker: EXT BURIAL SITE
dialogues.text: Earl begins to dig -

dialogues.speaker: EXT DIRT ROAD
dialogues.text: Martin's car heads up the road, the highway patrol car ri

dialogues.speaker: EXT BURIAL SITE
dialogues.text: Earl digs frantically --  Something is wrong.  He sees the cloud of dust down below approaching.  He digs faster.

dialogues.speaker: EXT TRAILER HOME
dialogues.text: Martin's car stops, parks next to Earl's.   She is about to head inside, when she looks up the hill, figure is standing, bent over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here, with your gun trained  on that door, until backup arrives. And she heads up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: EXT BURIAL SITE
dialogues.text: Earl is looking into the hole, puzzled. He reaches into the hole, pulls something out.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HILLSIDE
dialogues.text: Martin pulls out her weapon, cautious -- Suddenly - BLAM!!! A single shot pierces the air --  Martin looks around, down at the officer, then back up at

dialogues.speaker: EXT BURIAL SITE
dialogues.text: Earl falls to the ground, a single bullet wound in his fo gun rests in one hand, a note rests in the other.  In a f runs up to the site --  The note blows out of Earl's hand --  Martin inspects the scene, bewildered --  As she picks up the note, the camera begins a long PULL-B We MOVE up, over the scene, higher still, past the cars, desert floor, PANNING as we hear Booth's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're gonna kill me for this, partner,  but your debts are pretty big, and this money is a real t It's not that I don't trust you.  I just know how tough t been for you recently, and I'll keep helping out all I ca the money somewheres else, and as soon as this blows over I will go dig it up together.  Hope you aren't too mad. Y my partner, come hell or high water, and I'm only doing t for the both of us.   FADE OUT.
